intro: Mariscus uitenhagensis, commonly known as the Uitenhagen's mariscus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to a small region in South Africa. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae, characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements make it particularly vulnerable to environmental changes. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species from extinction.
